page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT, RUGELEY
page.content: Rugeley is a small industrial and market town in rural Staffordshire. People living in Rugeley and Colton work for the 5 main employers - Lea Hall colliery, the 2 power stations, Armitage Shanks, Thorn Automation and Celcon. There are 2 small industrial estates in the Trent Valley and 1 at Brereton nearby. Rugeley is 8 miles from other towns and so provides work in shops and services. The surrounding countryside is good farmland but few people work in farming. Many people from Rugeley work outside the town, travelling as far as Birmingham, Stoke-on-Trent and Derby. The local unemployment level is 18% compared with the national average of 13%. This is higher than the unemployment level in neighbouring towns but should fall as new jobs are attracted into Rugeley with government aid.
